ref: 8657 pradará m. ʻ cleft in earth ʼ VS., ʻ rout (of an army) ʼ MBh. &rcirclemacr Pa. padara -- n. ʻ cleft, fissure, board, plank ʼ (patara<-> with t as Si. spelling for d as frequently in Si. inscr.: otherwise Trenckner Notes 6216, Geiger PLS 39); Pk. payara -- m. ʻ splitting, breaking ʼ; K. paira, pör, ˚ra m. ʻ fear, agitation ʼ; Si. puvara ʻ plank ʼ; -- Ku. N. pairo ʻ landslip ʼ rather from prakara -- .
